intro: Pygeum lanceolatum var. valetonianum, commonly known as the Valetonian African cherry, is a small evergreen tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered white flowers. The plant produces red, fleshy berries that contain seeds, which are dispersed by animals. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in woodland and savanna habitats. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is cultivated in some regions for horticultural and pharmaceutical purposes.
